parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version1 </name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version2 </name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its config class).
* 0: no damage
* 1: full damage
See also [[BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage]] for setting hit with dependency

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> vehicle '''setHitPointDamage''' [hitPointName, damage, useEffects]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle : [[Object]] - vehicle to be damaged

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [hitPointName, damage]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> hitPointName: [[String]] - name of the Hit Point class

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> damage: [[Number]] - level of damage

</value></part><part><name>p5 </name>=<value> useEffects (Optional, default [[true]]): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to skip destruction effects <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.67</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[vehicle]] [[player]] [[setHitPointDamage]] ["hitEngine2", 1.0];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setHitPointDamage]] ["hitHead", 0.5];
[[player]] [[setHitPointDamage]] ["hitBody", 0.5];
[[player]] [[setHitPointDamage]] ["hitHands", 0.5];
[[player]] [[setHitPointDamage]] ["hitLegs", 0.5];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getHitPointDamage]], [[getAllHitPointsDamage]], [[setHit]], [[getHit]], [[setDamage]], [[damage]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]], [[BIS_fnc_setHitPointDamage]], [[getHitPointDamage#Notes|Common TKOH Hit Points]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 30, 2012 - 13:54</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Master85|Master85]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This command is using the Hit Points (defined in the HitPoints class in the config) while [[setHit]] is using [[Named_Selection|Named Selections]] (defined in the model itself).

<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 10, 2016</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kju|Kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">This command has no affect when [[allowDamage]] is false.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 14, 2016 - 03:06</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Demellion|Demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Mention that '''setHitPointDamage''' only can be executed localy, while the [[getHitPointDamage]] is global.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
